form.official-title: To require the Administrator of the Federal Emergency Management Agency to establish a working group relating to best practices and Federal guidance for animals in emergencies and disasters, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Planning for Animal Wellness Act or the PAW Act.

paragraph.text: The term Administrator means the Administrator of the Federal Emergency Management Agency.
The term working group means the advisory working group established under subsection (b).

subsection.text: Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator shall establish an advisory working group.
The working group shall consist of—

paragraph.text: not less than 2 representatives of State governments with experience in animal emergency management;
not less than 2 representatives of local governments with experience in animal emergency management;
not less than 2 representatives from academia;
not less than 2 representatives from nonprofit organizations working to address the needs of households pets and service animals in emergencies or disasters;
representatives from the Federal Animal Emergency Management Working Group; and
any other members determined necessary by the Administrator.

encourage and foster collaborative efforts among individuals and entities working to address the needs of household pets, service and assistance animals, and captive animals, as appropriate, in emergency and disaster preparedness, response, and recovery; and

review best practices and Federal guidance, as of the date of enactment of this Act, on congregate and noncongregate sheltering and evacuation planning relating to the needs of household pets, service and assistance animals, and captive animals, as appropriate, in emergency and disaster preparedness, response, and recovery.

subsection.text: Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, the working group shall determine whether the best practices and Federal guidance described in subsection (d)(2) are sufficient.

Not later than 540 days after the date of enactment of this Act, if the Administrator, in consultation with the working group, determines that the best practices and Federal guidance described in paragraph subsection (d)(2) are insufficient, the Administrator, in consultation with the working group, shall publish updated Federal guidance.
